I wonder why the reference module is always pinned on https://github.com/backdrop-contrib. Was it just a temporary measure and someone forgot to unpin the module or is there a special reason why the module should stay there on top of the page?

Join the group at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib to add your own! - Backdrop CMS contributed projects

I believe it's there because it's a candidate for core inclusion: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1301

[META][D8] Add reference(s) module to core 路 Issue #1301 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need I use node and user references all the time. It would be great if we could add these to core. Proposed solution We should create a new module reference that is a rewrite of ...
Correct, and as such, to give it (more) visibility to get stuff done, though that doesn't seem to have worked out.
Yeah nobody is jumping to finish it

I, personally, would love to jump in to help finish it, but I have so many things in my plate and my wish lists that I have to stick to priorities, and my highest priority at the moment is increasing my income.
